poem:
Hostages

In the tangled streets
of Gaza—hope sways,
bodies retrieved like whispers,
their silence more
piercing than sirens.
Desolate hearts
echo in corridors—
where will peace find light?
A skyline bruised,
the world's breath,
held.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Israel-Gaza war: Israeli forces retrieve bodies of five hostages from Gaza, military says – as it happened 4.00pm BST Closing summary Houthi attacks on Israel in solidarity with Palestinians in Gaza will continue and not be deterred by Israeli airstrikes near Yemen’s Hodeidah port, the Iran-backed group’s leader Abdulmalik al-Houthi said in a televised speech on Thursday. “The response is inevitable,” Abdulmalik al-Houthi said. Russian president Vladimir Putin met Bashar al-Assad in the Kremlin as". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
